chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (2nd) and Operating w/ PAC (2nd). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (2nd) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (2nd) was dismissed by the court.

  • Corey L. Cihlar was found guilty of OWI (2nd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

With Huber and Good Time Credit.   Court has no objection to sentence being served in another jurisdiction provided the Defendant can make the appropriate arrangements.   Pursuant to s. 346.65(7), Wis. Stats., Defendant shall be required to remain in the County Jail for not less than a 48 consecutive hour period prior to release for huber.
Prior to re-licensing the defendant is to complete an OWI Assessment.

Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

records.descr: Order for intox driver assessment and safety plan

records.addlTxt: 10:50 am cases called. 15CM329, 15TR2246, 15TR2247, & 15TR2248.  Attorney Michael E Sias in court.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. DA Blader states argued sentence.   Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: No Contest to Count 1.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC.  Court dismisses outright Count 2 and dismisses and reads-in Count 3, 15TR2246, 15TR2247, & 15TR2248. Sentencing argument by DA Blader. Sentencing argument by Attorney Sias. Statement by defendant. Court sentences the defendant to: 28 days WCJ, with Huber and Good Time Credit. To begin no later than February 15, 2016. No Credit time served. Court does not object to jail transfer. 48 hour rule explained. $1618.00 fine inclusive of costs to be paid , 16 month DL revocation, 16 mo IID-effective today, OWI assessment. DNA Sample and Surcharge ordered by the Court.  Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice. Appeal Rights Given.

Case called @ 2:21 p.m. Attorney Michael E Sias in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Sias is unsure as to why his client is not present today. Attempts to call his client have been unsuccessful. The court will reschedule the matter due to the previous participation of the defendant.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 19, 2016 at 10:30 am.
from Atty Sias requesting adjournment - Granted by the Court

Complete ID process with the Sheriff's Department.   The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.    No operation of any motor vehicles without a valid driver's license.

Case Called @ 3:50 PM: Defendant Corey L. Cihlar in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel. Def wants counsel and intends to retain his own counsel as he will not qualify for SPD services.   NGP entered by Court.   STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Status conference scheduled for October 21, 2015 at 10:00 am.
